alert.note: Alert for Central Colorado River Basin; Gore and Elk Mountains, Central Mountain Valleys (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 20 at 12:53PM MST by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: .An ice jam release may cause a rapid increase in water levels and flow in the Roaring Fork River. ...FLOOD WATCH FOR AN ICE JAM REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of the Roaring Fork from Basalt to Carbondale. * WHEN...Until 5 PM MST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Anglers and anyone near or in the Roaring Fork River should use extreme caution and be on the lookout for ice and debris flowing in the river. Move away from the river and seek higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A thick layer of anchor and surface ice along the Roaring Fork River may result in an ice jam within Snowmass Canyon. Warmer temperatures forecast for the end of the week increase the potential for an ice jam release, which would cause a rapid rise in water levels and flow immediately downstream. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Emergency management and law enforcement are asking all citizens to use extreme caution in and around the Roaring Fork River.

area.areaDesc: Central Colorado River Basin; Gore and Elk Mountains, Central Mountain Valleys
